Job Title: Assistant Superintendent

Location: Kenosha, WI

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Project Management

Description:
SUMMARY: Bear is hiring an Assistant Construction Superintendent/Engineer to handle needs for its local/regional projects. The position requires an understanding of various project management skills. This person should be able to assist with overseeing the day-to-day activities of the entire project as it relates to the construction of commercial buildings, everything from site work to building turnover. The Assistant Superintendent will be responsible for all functions of the job site as it relates to day-to-day on-site construction activities. They need to be able to manage the project from site development through occupancy while monitoring job costs and construction quality. The assistant superintendent will work alongside the onsite senior superintendent each day.
DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Plan and direct construction activities of the Subcontractors, Labors, and other staff as assignedResponsible for construction and presentation of the project in a timely mannerScheduling of all subcontractorsApproves work being performed by subcontractors and handles any issues that may arise.Monitor project to ensure it is built per plans and specifications.Maintain a safe work site by implementing good housekeeping regulations and safety requirements, enforcing safe work habits and observing OSHA and any state-level agencies` regulationsMonitor site cleanlinessConduct detailed inspections after each trade has completed its tasks and before any work is authorized for paymentWork with appropriate city officials and inspectors as neededPerform checklists and reports that aid in controlling aspects of the construction process under his or her responsibilityPrepare punch-list audit for each project and ensure that all punch-list items have been completed prior to customer orientations/occupancyManage project close-out and final documentation  QUALIFICATIONS:3+ years of solid hands-on experience with a GC or with a developerKnowledge of local Building Codes is requiredKnowledge of Project Management Scheduling SoftwareKnowledge with Excel based Project budgets 

The above is intended to describe the general content of and requirements for the performance of this job. It is not to be construed as an exhaustive statement of duties, responsibilities or physical requirements. Nothing in this job description restricts managementâ€™s right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
